techmeme.title: A look at Caroline Ellison's motivations in the FTX fraud, including her relationship with SBF; the judge said he had "never seen" a cooperator like Ellison (Elizabeth Lopatto/The Verge)
The Allen Institute for AI releases the Multimodal Open Language Model, or Molmo, in 1B and 70B-parameter sizes, the most capable open source AI model yet (Will Knight/Wired)
Biden plans to sign a new bill that weakens some environmental rules on federally funded chip projects, breaking with environmental groups and House Democrats (Politico)
Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai says the US search and ads antitrust lawsuits are "going to take time ... to play out" and an appeal "will likely take many years" (Alicia Clanton/Bloomberg)
Whatfix, which helps companies demo how to use third-party software, raised a $125M Series E led by Warburg Pincus at an estimated ~$900M valuation (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)

source_2.title: James McAvoy and Tom Brady fall for 'Goodbye Meta AI' hoax
Terminator creator James Cameron joins board of AI company
Caroline Ellison sentenced to two years for role in FTX crypto fraud
CrowdStrike boss apologises for global IT outage
Sharp rise in problematic teenage social media use, study says
